name: Pancakes
instructions:
1. In a large bowl, whisk together the flour, sugar, baking powder, baking soda, and salt.
2. In a separate bowl, whisk together the egg, milk, and melted butter.
3. Add the wet ingredients to the dry ingredients and whisk until just combined.
4. Heat a lightly greased griddle or frying pan over medium heat.
5. Pour 1/4 cup of batter onto the griddle for each pancake.
6. Cook for 2-3 minutes per side, or until golden brown and cooked through.
7. Serve immediately with your favorite toppings.

name: Waffles
ingredients: 1 cup all-purpose flour, 2 tablespoons sugar, 2 teaspoons baking powder, 1/2 teaspoon baking soda, 1/4 teaspoon salt, 1 egg, 1 1/2 cups milk, 1/4 cup melted butter
instructions:
1. In a large bowl, whisk together the flour, sugar, baking powder, baking soda, and salt.
2. In a separate bowl, whisk together the egg, milk, and melted butter.
3. Add the wet ingredients to the dry ingredients and whisk until just combined.
4. Preheat a waffle iron according to the manufacturer's instructions.
5. Pour 1/2 cup of batter onto the waffle iron.
6. Cook for 2-3 minutes per side, or until the waffle is golden brown and cooked through.
7. Serve immediately with your favorite toppings.

name: French Toast
ingredients: 2 slices of bread, 1 egg, 1/4 cup milk, 1/4 teaspoon vanilla extract, 1/4 teaspoon ground cinnamon, 1 tablespoon butter
instructions:
1. In a shallow bowl, whisk together the egg, milk, vanilla extract, and cinnamon.
2. Dip the bread slices into the egg mixture, turning to coat both sides.
3. Heat the butter in a frying pan over medium heat.
4. Place the bread slices in the frying pan and cook for 2-3 minutes per side, or until golden brown and cooked through.
5. Serve immediately with your favorite toppings.

name: Chicken Noodle Soup
ingredients: 1 pound boneless, skinless chicken breasts, cut into 1-inch pieces, 1 onion, chopped, 2 carrots, chopped, 2 celery stalks, chopped, 8 cups chicken broth, 1/2 teaspoon salt, 1/4 teaspoon black pepper, 1/4 teaspoon dried thyme, 1/8 teaspoon dried rosemary, 1/4 cup chopped fresh parsley, 1 package (8 ounces) egg noodles, cooked according to package directions
instructions:
1. In a large pot, combine the chicken, onion, carrots, celery, chicken broth, salt, pepper, thyme, and rosemary. Bring to a boil over high heat.
2. Reduce the heat to low and simmer for 15 minutes, or until the chicken is cooked through.
3. Stir in the parsley and cooked egg noodles.
4. Serve immediately.

name: Beef Stew
ingredients: 1 pound boneless beef chuck roast, cut into 1-inch cubes, 1 tablespoon olive oil, 1 onion, chopped, 2 carrots, chopped, 2 celery stalks, chopped, 1 teaspoon dried thyme, 1/2 teaspoon dried rosemary, 1/4 teaspoon black pepper, 1/4 teaspoon salt, 4 cups beef broth, 1 (14.5 ounce) can diced tomatoes, undrained, 1 (15 ounce) can potatoes, drained, 3/4 cup frozen peas and carrots
instructions:
1. Heat the olive oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add the beef and cook until browned on all sides.
2. Add the onion, carrots, celery, thyme, rosemary, pepper, and salt to the pot and cook until softened, about 5 minutes.
3. Stir in the beef broth, diced tomatoes, and potatoes. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to low and simmer for 1 hour, or until the beef is tender.
4. Stir in the frozen peas and carrots and cook until heated through. Serve hot.

name: Chicken Pot Pie
ingredients: 1 tablespoon olive oil, 1 onion, chopped, 2 carrots, chopped, 2 celery stalks, chopped, 1 pound boneless, skinless chicken breasts, cut into 1-inch pieces, 1/2 teaspoon salt, 1/4 teaspoon black pepper, 1/4 cup all-purpose flour, 4 cups chicken broth, 1 (15 ounce) can corn, drained, 1 (15 ounce) can peas and carrots, drained, 1 (15 ounce) can mixed vegetables, drained, 1 package (16 ounces) refrigerated pie crusts, thawed
instructions:
1. Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).
2. Heat the olive oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add the onion, carrots, and celery and cook until softened, about 5 minutes.
3. Add the chicken, salt, and pepper to the pot and cook until the chicken is browned on all sides.
4. Stir in the flour and cook for 1 minute.
5. Gradually whisk in the chicken broth and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low and simmer for 10 minutes, or until the chicken is cooked through.
6. Stir in the corn, peas and carrots, and mixed vegetables.
7. Pour the filling into a 9x13 inch baking dish. Top with pie crusts and crimp the edges to seal.
8. Cut several slits in the top of the pie crust to allow steam to escape.
9. Bake for 20-25 minutes, or until the crust is golden brown.
10. Let cool for 10 minutes before serving.

name: Chili
ingredients: 1 tablespoon olive oil, 1 onion, chopped, 2 green bell peppers, chopped, 2 jalapeno peppers, seeded and minced (optional), 2 cloves garlic, minced, 1 pound ground beef, 1 (15 ounce) can kidney beans, drained and rinsed, 1 (15 ounce) can black beans, drained and rinsed, 1 (15 ounce) can pinto beans, drained and rinsed, 1 (14.5 ounce) can diced tomatoes, undrained, 1 (10 ounce) can tomato sauce, 1 (10 ounce) can beef broth, 1 tablespoon chili powder, 1 teaspoon cumin, 1/2 teaspoon salt, 1/4 teaspoon black pepper
instructions:
1. Heat the olive oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add the onion, bell peppers, jalapeno peppers (if using), and garlic and cook until softened, about 5 minutes.
2. Add the ground beef to the pot and cook until browned.
3. Stir in the kidney beans, black beans, pinto beans, diced tomatoes, tomato sauce, beef broth, chili powder, cumin, salt, and pepper. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to low and simmer for 30 minutes, or until the chili has thickened.
4. Serve hot with your favorite toppings, such as shredded cheese, sour cream, and avocado.

name: Spaghetti and Meatballs
ingredients: 1 pound ground beef, 1/2 cup bread crumbs, 1/4 cup grated Parmesan cheese, 1 egg, beaten, 1/4 cup chopped onion, 1/4 cup chopped parsley, 1/2 teaspoon garlic powder, 1/4 teaspoon salt, 1/4 teaspoon black pepper, 1 (28 ounce) can crushed tomatoes, 1/2 cup water, 1 pound spaghetti
instructions:
1. Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).
2. In a large bowl, combine the ground beef, bread crumbs, Parmesan cheese, egg, onion, parsley, garlic powder, salt, and pepper. Mix well.
3. Shape the beef mixture into 1-inch meatballs.
4. Place the meatballs on a baking sheet and bake for 15-20 minutes, or until cooked through.
5. While the meatballs are baking, heat the crushed tomatoes and water in a large saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a simmer and cook for 10 minutes, or until thickened slightly.
6. Add the meatballs to the tomato sauce and cook for an additional 10 minutes, or until heated through.
7. Cook the spaghetti according to package directions.
8. Drain the spaghetti and add it to the tomato sauce. Toss to coat.
9. Serve immediately with your favorite toppings, such as grated Parmesan cheese, shredded mozzarella cheese, and chopped fresh parsley.

name: Macaroni and Cheese
ingredients: 1 pound elbow macaroni, 1/4 cup butter, 1/4 cup all-purpose flour, 4 cups milk, 1 teaspoon salt, 1/2 teaspoon black pepper, 1/4 teaspoon garlic powder, 1/4 teaspoon onion powder, 2 cups shredded cheddar cheese
instructions:
1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
2. Cook the macaroni according to package directions.
3. While the macaroni is cooking, melt the butter in a large saucepan over medium heat. Whisk in the flour and cook for 1 minute.
4. Gradually whisk in the milk until smooth. Bring to a simmer and cook for 5 minutes, or until thickened slightly.
5. Stir in the salt, pepper, garlic powder, and onion powder.
6. Drain the macaroni and add it to the cheese sauce. Toss to coat.
7. Pour the macaroni and cheese into a greased 9x13 inch baking dish.
8. Sprinkle the cheddar cheese over the top.
9. Bake for 20 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and bubbly.
10. Serve immediately.
